website_summaries.verdict: Valve's Steam Link media streamer lets you play any Steam game installed on your PC on your HDTV over your Wi-Fi network.
cons: Requires a fast router, ideally with either your PC or the Steam Link connected via Ethernet

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat this for $20
customer_reviews.text: Streams games in 1080P from PC to livingroom TV. Need to spend a LOT more to get Nvidia Shield to attempt to stream games in 4k. Not worth it, as my TV (Samsung KS8000) upconverts 1080P well. Long story short: $20 gets me livingroom gaming without an ugly wire dangling across the floor like a snake.
customer_reviews.author: I_AM

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic little piece of technology
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this small box in hopes of bringing my PC games to the living room - but it does SO much more than that. This device can fully stream 1080p 60fps with barely ANY latency from your desktop with barely any setup from any PC in the house - allowing the entire family to use it to watch movies, play games, and use their computers from the living room (perfect for family nights and having people over). And the bes We've been using the Link on an almost daily basis for about 3 years now, and suffice to say it was a worthwhile investment. Truly a great surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Itzikf

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Contantly freezes on a wired connection thus rendering the entire purpose useless. Constantly had to restart the link connection by getting on my PC. Trek back and forth, exactly what I don't want to be doing when I'm gaming on my TV. What I do now is stream my PC to my laptop via steam in home streaming. I connect the laptop to the TV via HDMI. This is built in to the software and free.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a simple as it seems
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend this to anyone as a primary system. Simply too many issues. Between resolution constantly switching, random errors every other time a game is started, I’m about to give up. It works about 1 out of every 10 times without some sort of hassle. Forget running the PC headless as it will just never work. You literally need a monitor that matches the resolution of your TV, despite the fact that the entire purpose of this product is to not use that monitor. Such a poorly implemented product. You would think the difficult part would be latency but no, that works just fine. It’s the simple things that make it nearly impossible to use.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Z

customer_reviews.title: Functions as advertised, but rather pointless!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the price was right: a $15 experiment. After getting it all up and running I have determined that this is pointless for my purposes. The main thing that bothers me is your PC streams this to your TV, mirrored. It also forces open Big Screen mode in order to function. This completely takes over your PC interface. The fact that I cannot use my PC for anything other than streaming steam in big picture mode when activated makes this very undesirable. I can just do this better myself with an additional monitor cable attached to my TV. No streaming needed. My only thought is that this is for people with much larger spaces than me.
customer_reviews.author: Ajeet N.

customer_reviews.title: A Small, Powerful Device
customer_reviews.text: This little sleek device does a lot for 50 bucks (can be found for 35 on sale). Wireless is ok if you're within good range, but wired ethernet is strongly recommended. The interface is nice; Steam Big Picture's layout, speed and look is better than the console's UI. It has USBs for controllers, keyboard/mice, and headsets. PS Even if you don't play games you can still stream your PC's desktop. Turn your TV into a monitor in another room. Great alternative to a HTPC.
customer_reviews.author: Brian R

customer_reviews.title: Interesting product...not fully implemented, IMO
customer_reviews.text: Good for people who don't want to expend sending an HDMI/Thunderbolt port to your 4K/1080p HD TV in another room of the house away from your PC; nowhere near the PC itself. However, I am a bit disappointed with the res downscaling and pixelation when watching movies from this device, or even playing games from it and streaming from my 1920x1080p HD Acer monitor. Not sure how to fix that, but there is probably just something that I have to change internally. Otherwise, a great buy for that reason: little to non-existent input lag, or latency. (I highly recommend that your Steam Link machine is hardwired with an Ethernet cord (CAT5 or 7) instead of using Wifi...wifi is horrendous)
customer_reviews.author: Mudda Goose

customer_reviews.title: Works great, except the input lag because it's a streaming device
customer_reviews.text: This works pretty well, but you are going to have input lag. So be prepared to play some games where pinpoint precision is NOT a requirement. Something turn based, or strategy would be best for this. Maybe something like The Sims? I would NOT play street fighter, counter strike, DOTA, or anything competitive at all using this. It's just too frustrating with the input lag. And I get that it's a streaming device. There is going to be input lag. It's expected. But it is a downside, so I gotta take a star off.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: This is a good device but there are a few problems that prevent ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good device but there are a few problems that prevent greatness. 1.) An HDMI cable is better. If you are within an HDMI cables length, just use that. I run a 25 foot one. 2.)Windows Auth or UAC. You must unlock your computer at the computer before using the steam link if you use a password. The steamlink will not allow you to type anything before doing this. 3.) Connectivity is fine, but only if hardwired, which kind of defeats the purpose.If this thing was both fast and wireless it would be a lot better. 4.)A steam controller is simply amazing. Get one now. But the steam link needs better tech before its usable.
customer_reviews.author: Big Head

customer_reviews.title: Works great if you have the right setup.
customer_reviews.text: With the proper configuration this is an awesome product. I would not recommend using it for online FPS, however I play MGS V and we play coop EDF 4.1 and its great. Works well with the steam controller or xbox 1 controller. I tried a few different configurations using WiFi and wired connections to get it to work properly. Steam link on 2.4 with PC on 2.4 = Completely unuseable Steam link on 5.0 with PC on 5.0 = Realistically unuseable Steam link on 5.0 with PC wired = Awesome no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Knoll

customer_reviews.title: I have a great network setup and still get some input delay
customer_reviews.text: Has issues streaming on 5ghz band. Works okay on 2.4ghz... I have a great network setup and still get some input delay. I tested it connected via Ethernet right into the router and it really wasn't much of an improvement. It was recently updated to support X-Input but the layout mapping is extremely frustrating. Ended up having to purchase VirtualHere to properly configure my fightpad remotely from my PC. Overall, worth $20 if you have a desire to stream things from your PC to a TV. You just can't be picky about the outcome.
customer_reviews.author: Samson

customer_reviews.title: Neat lil link
customer_reviews.text: This thing is wicked handy. I use it all the time as an alternative to a home theater pc Pros: -The only way the picture/audio quality could get better is if it was hardwired -Input lag doesn't really seem to exist -Fairly easy set up even if you are using multiple computers Cons: -You are forced to be online in steam -It always sends you to the Big Screen Mode splash screen -Have heard of some issues of lag/quality over wireless(I am hard wired and haven't had an issue) Overall, really neat box.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: Impressive, setting up is great workout
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool product, although the seller I got mine from sent me a very obviously used and dirty product marketed as new. I returned it and got another from the actual Steam website. You'll have to make about 10 trips up and down your stairs, but the end result is a really impressive setup for using your computer from elsewhere in your house. Definitely not limited to Steam games, as I use mine for everything from art programs to Excel. At this price point it's probably the best option out there at the moment. I've tried screen streaming apps out the wazoo, and there's just no match for the Steam Link.
customer_reviews.author: Deeje & Sydney

customer_reviews.title: Bring your PC/Steam games into your living room with ease
customer_reviews.text: I was very hesitant to jump on the band wagon of using this thing. I connected it to my network with ease.Interface was easy to understand and I was up and connected to my steam account within minutes. Great use of the front tv when playing video games with my family. I purchased a usb hub to add an additional 4 usb ports. Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub with Individual Power Switches and LEDs (HB-UMLS) This connects with the extra xbox 360 controllers with no additional drivers. Completely worth the $49.00 I spent on it when I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Hardline this and your host PC.
customer_reviews.text: Was terrible at first, but after hardwiring both the host PC and the Steam link all is fine. I thought it wouldn't have streaming issues with an AC wireless network, but only hardlining both devices made it work consistently. Running 1080p 60fps on "Beautiful" compression setting just fine now. Beforehand I could barely stream anything at the ugliest compression. After updating, the newer Xbox One controller pairs via bluetooth and works great. You can even "power on" the steam link like you would an Xbox using the controller. Has a few interface design quirks.
customer_reviews.author: maxmouse

customer_reviews.title: but the quality really isn't that great. If you're going to use it for wifi ...
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's supposed to do, but the quality really isn't that great. If you're going to use it for wifi streaming, then you know from the outset that the quality isn't great; but one might assume that using a physical connection (like an ethernet cord) would have near-perfect quality. Apparently, that is not the case, as even plugging it into my router, computer, and the screen I'm displaying to (Steam link next to the TV with a very long ethernet cord) gives me a fuzzy-ish picture. I ended up returning the item; I could accomplish the same task with much less complication using an incredibly long HDMI cord.
customer_reviews.author: eka-radon118

customer_reviews.title: SteamOS + GNU/Linux especially in Big Picture mode looks beautiful and I can play several hundreds of SteamOS + ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product including the Steam Link and Hisense 40H4C 40" Roku HDTV. I own a 2015 ZaReason Zeto desktop and Sager NP8657 [Clevo P650-RE3] laptop both of which run Ubuntu 15.10 64 bit GNU/Linux. I connected it using a gigabit Ethernet cable to my Verizon FiOS Quantum Gateway Router and 150/150 MB/s Internet home service. SteamOS + GNU/Linux especially in Big Picture mode looks beautiful and I can play several hundreds of SteamOS + GNU/Linux PC games on my HDTV using the Steam Controller without wires. It just works. Be sure to use gigabit ethernet and Ubuntu 15.10 64 bit GNU/Linux or higher for maximum compatibility and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Welly WU

customer_reviews.title: Works better than i expected.
customer_reviews.text: This works beautifully and streams flawlessly 1920x1080p resolution. I was even more ecstatic that it does the whole desktop also, essential this is like a second monitor per say and just mimics the original monitor. Also being able to play all my emulators from the couch works out great also. Its just a shame Valve has stopped production on these and will ultimately raise the price on these now. Get them while you can!!!
customer_reviews.author: Neo

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with mine and its performance.
customer_reviews.text: DISCLAIMER: Use a wired connection. Do not try to stream latency-sensitive tasks like gaming video, audio, and input over a wireless connection. It just doesn't make sense. Hook this up to a HUB, run a cable and you'll be gaming comfortably in your couch. Very happy with mine and its performance. One side-benefit is now I can game and be insulated from the noise of my CPU and GPU fans. Steam (probably due to licensing agreements), doesn't allow full-desktop streaming for general application use, just gaming. However if you search the web for "steam in-home desktop streaming github" you'll find some solutions that allow this to allow be a nice way to use normal desktop functions, watch movies, etc.
customer_reviews.author: drac

customer_reviews.title: I wish i had purchased this much sooner.
customer_reviews.text: Steam link is amazing, I have a great computer,in the living room. But I am sick so I want to play on the bed.this enables me to add even non steam games to my steam library and play them laying down,.I hooked up and keyboard and mouse and now am happily playing in bed Diablo 3 and my other 50 games I got in my library of steam. I just wish I had bought one sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Keci

customer_reviews.title: Brings the PC into the living room
customer_reviews.text: I run Steam on Ubuntu 16.04 and this works great for anything running through Steam. Streaming the desktop works fairly well so I can bring streaming content from websites right to the TV without special screen casting hardware on my computer. I wouldn't recommend trying to use it via a wireless connection as there are latency issues when gaming and skipping when streaming video on my wireless N router. A wireless AC router may work better but I don't have one to test with. I use Xbox 360 wireless controllers via the official Xbox 360 wireless controller USB adapter without any issues on this. Even with 4 controllers synced and in use there are no noticeable delays or issues.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: DooM on my 55" LG OLED Looks AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: My house is already wired with Cat5e Ethernet cable so this was a no brainer. The performance is outstanding - there is NO perceptible lag of any kind over Ethernet and I feel like I'm sitting at my PC when playing DooM on my 55" LG OLED TV. I've been using a wired XBox 360 controller for games but it's hard to adjust from a mouse/keyboard. I may buy a wireless keyboard and mouse so that I can ditch the XBox controller. BTW I'm also piping the audio for my games through my 300W stereo system so DooM looks and sounds EPIC. For 20 bucks this was an absolute steal.
customer_reviews.author: mmarkows

customer_reviews.title: This works so great for streaming video games to your television - now ...
customer_reviews.text: This works so great for streaming video games to your television - now I can play my Steam games as though they were console games. I got a Steam Link controller as well as an Xbox wired controller to go with and they both work very well, though the Steam controller takes a bit of adjusting to learn. My only recommendation is to make sure to hook it up with an ethernet cable so that the games run more smoothly - the games were almost unplayable without the ethernet cable.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth It
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for literally a day and now all I can get it to do reliably is have connection issues. Christ my phone has better connection to the wifi than this piece of plastic trash. Doesn't help that it doesn't even have a god damn power button, so to turn it off and on you have to walk up and plug and un-plug, nor does it have an easy way to pair any controller that isn't a Steam Controller, a thing you can't even get anymore without going broke in the process. Not worth the price (Or any price honestly), don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: It is very good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: It is very good value for the money. Not only it allows to play steam games to TV, but also it is able to stream my whole desktop (I'm on Linux, though). Then I'm able to pair my Playstation 4 DualShock controller with my laptop and even control the mouse on controllers' touchpad. NOTE: When you are not streaming a Steam game, you have to pair your controller with the computer, not with the Steam Link. Very convenient device, worth every penny - no need to bring your laptop, no need to attach and detach the cables...
customer_reviews.author: Ruslan Balkin

customer_reviews.title: Works great overall. I have it connected to wireless 802
customer_reviews.text: Works great overall. I have it connected to wireless 802.11ac that is in the room below the Steam Link. Network performance is nearly flawless at full quality level. I have a very powerful PC so that is not a bottleneck for the device. Xbox 360 controller connected easily. One irritation is sometimes I will lose Steam Big Picture and get the full desktop on the TV instead. This would actually very cool if the Steam Link had a simple "mirror desktop" mode but being it is intermittent then it's frustrating if you don't also have a keyboard/mouse plugged into it so you can get back to Big Picture mode. For the money though, this product is a no-brainer!
customer_reviews.author: Eric J. Majerus

customer_reviews.title: Play with your friends together
customer_reviews.text: Manage to snag it on a sale. I've owned it for several months and yet to have an issue. I bought it to help give my lower back a rest from sitting on the computer chair all day. Now I can play the exact same games I do on steam on my tv in my room. I can even cast what I view on my desktop to my tv (movies, YouTube's, etc.). The best part is being able to play games with your friends at your place on your tv. Sometimes I purchase a game for the single player and the multiplayer is one that's best enjoyed with friends. That's when Steam Link comes in to play.
customer_reviews.author: Ampeed

customer_reviews.title: Works great over wired connection, great piece of hardware if you play a lot of Steam games.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a ton of games in your Steam library and play them often, but just want the ability to play in any room then this is for you. It works without issue as long as you're over a wired connection. I had been wanting to try this for a while but never pulled the trigger, so when it hit 50% off I took the chance. The option to add non Steam games to your library to play is nice as well, I was able to stream World of Warcraft and Overwatch to my living room and play without issue. Unfortunately I will be returning though, as I don't feel I'll use it often enough to justify keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: This has been fantastic. I'm one of those gamers who's gone from ...
customer_reviews.text: This has been fantastic. I'm one of those gamers who's gone from PC to console to PC to console to PC to ... well you get the idea. There's a lot to be said for the freedom and comfort of the living room and the Steam Link has not disappointed. Aside from a very rare stutter, it has performed flawlessly and I really like that it can WOL and shut down your PC without having to go all the way to wherever you keep it. Can't wait to see what improvements they roll out on the software!
customer_reviews.author: Josh I.

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  I hope it gets continued support for improvements.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I wish I had known about it sooner. Simply put, you can stream content from your computer through Steam, to your TV, over your network. You can even "add non-steam" content to steam. By using Steam to load it, you can essentially access many features of your computer through Steam. It isn't perfect, but it is pretty cool. I have been having trouble getting Star Wars Battlefront (Origin) to work correctly using this method. Needless to say, if all it did was allow me to stream my Steam library to the computer, I would be happy. That is, after all, why I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for ethernet networks, iffy for wireless networks. Great in any situation that doesn't require extreme precision.
customer_reviews.text: Great with ethernet, but not quite such on a common wireless connection. Very little noticable I/O delay, I'd recommend a Steam Link for any gaming situation that doesn't require extreme precision. Racing games, rocket league and the common shooter game all work great; but I wouldn't try to play an online FPS/TPS with one. While the delay isn't bad at all, you will be at a disadvantage. As a $20 piece of kit to save me the effort of carrying a computer across the house (or let's be honest, across a room; I'm lazy) it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: This works great for me
customer_reviews.text: This works great for me. I can play all my games in another room in the house. It reads every USB peripheral without issue so far. There is no noticeable lag, and the display quality is great. These have been on sale for really really cheap and I've been tempted to buy one for every room in the house (that has a network connection). The only downside is that it really needs a hardlined connection. Which for my use, is fine but might be hard for some.
customer_reviews.author: Stickboy46

customer_reviews.title: they do work ALOT better with a ethernet cords plugged in
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Steam Link. The first one sits in our home theater area, this one I added to the TV in our workout space. While it isn't required, they do work ALOT better with a ethernet cords plugged in. I used powerline converters (TP-Link AV500) to set up my all my home theater with a hardline for the internet, and I bought a couple extra to do the same for the workout space now. It works a TON better than using my wireless for game streaming.
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: Great with the right setup
customer_reviews.text: I use it like this: - Ethernet to my PC - Steam link on Wi-Fi It works good enough that I can play Dark Souls and Life is Strange with no issues. I also played They Bleed Pixels with this setup. Now, if you get a better internet than mine (better architecture) and if you can get an ethernet cable to both, I am sure this would work amazingly.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Armendia

customer_reviews.title: Broforce in Bed
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Steam Link, its for my bedroom. I already have one set up for my living room and it works great with a blutooth Xbox One Controller. It would be better if it actually used the Xbox One Adapter but its perfect now. Only thing I would suggest is to try to wire in the Ethernet line instead of using wireless (sometimes can be spotty wireless). Its still a growing system so there is room for improvement but works great for what I need it for, playing Broforce in bed.
customer_reviews.author: Gaven Gautreaux

customer_reviews.title: Good, but far from perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I went into big picture mode with this my main PC always has trouble detecting controllers now. Some of my games had huge issues detecting my controllers properly when that was NEVER an issue before. Used a 360 controller with the Link and an Xbox One controller with my PC when switching between living room and game room respectively. Can't say it was a complete waste because it was only $20, but I've had issues with this and playing games like Hollow Knight back and forth. If I was to switch between both game room and living room frequently I would maybe do my research on an Nvidia Shield instead, but that's more pricey.
customer_reviews.author: D Rock

customer_reviews.title: Flawless Victory
customer_reviews.text: Works wonderfully. Picture is clear and almost no lag on wire connection. PS4 and XBox controllers work over Bluetooth without issue once setup and paired with unit, just not able to turn it off via the controller. Solid design and sturdy construction, does not feel cheap at all. Perfect for Big Picture mode It does work with Home Network Powerline adapters too, as the TV I wanted to use it on was on other side of the house. No issues. It does hang up in some games with display issues, but it is intermittent. Definitely recommend to anyone who wants to stream to that nice, big TV in your living room to play those gorgeous games on
customer_reviews.author: MSA

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Good for mirroring the computer screen. Not a Chromecast replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Apparently, the Steam Link simply mirrors the computer screen, regardless of whether it's related to the game or not. It's basically a really advanced Miracast. I've tested it on several computers, and it clearly works a lot faster on the ones with dedicated graphics cards. There's about a 0.2s delay on my network when playing games, so it's not ideal for games like Hollow Knight or Dark Souls that require a fast response time. Otherwise, it works really well. It doesn't completely replace my Chromecast because screen sharing (Steam Link) is a lot more resource/power intensive than streaming directly from a dedicated box (Chromecast). So both devices have their own purposes.
customer_reviews.author: HSuke

customer_reviews.title: Great when it works!
customer_reviews.text: Great when it works. Wired or not, I've had issues a plenty with these devices but still swear by them! I have a heavy computer that I'm tired of lugging around the house to an available TV or monitor, and this seemed like a viable alternative to that. I get good results with a power line router setup, but crap results with the wifi 90% of the time despite quick wifi speeds.
customer_reviews.author: hew

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I use it wirelessly and it works very well. Some games, like dungeon defenders(1) will not work for some reason. Which is unfortunately one of my favorite split screen games. Can't fault the link for that though. It's small, silent, and convenient. (Just wish I could log into my computer from the couch) Edit: Dungeon Defenders now no longer crashes when launched from the link. Not sure whether it was Steam or Link update or something else. Now, just allow me to login from the couch and it would be flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Gadget.
customer_reviews.text: I'm device works it's great. I cannot tell the difference between my computer being directly plugged into the TV or across the house and down a floor. Since the device has 3 USB ports I have a mouse a keyboard and a controller plugged into the steam link at the same time; all of which response seamlessly. This clutch might be on the side of my computer. Almost every time I first turn on my computer and connect to the steam link, the steam link has very bad latency. After restarting my computer and reconnecting the latency will go away and the device will work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, Works really well, really fast response time. I did notice that it does take a while to load details so sometimes looks a little fuzzy, but there is barely any response time, nice and fast. I currently run CAT6 line from my pc to modem and then modem to my lounge where the TV is where i have set this up. Perhaps with CAT7 the or something with a higher speed then CAT6 it would not do this as much, but its still very playable and works really well. And yes, you can see your desktop using this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth its weight in gold, possibly double.
customer_reviews.text: Worth double what I paid. That I can sit my lard ass in my recliner downstairs, on my huge television, and play Skyrim/ Doom/ Tides of Numenera/etc, without having to build a new computer, is just awesome. Seriously one of the best pieces of tech I own right now. Minimal lag if at all, incredible picture, practically no artifacts from signal loss, convenience. The only issue I have, a minor one of course, is that the volume is still reliant on what the volume setting is on my computer. That's how much I have struggled to come up with a negative about a $20 piece of technology that has made my gaming life much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Shabba

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic deal
customer_reviews.text: Steam link has been a great purchase. I have a gaming computer and installed a lot of games, but I keep it upstairs. The lounge is downstairs with the main TV. I set up the Steam link in the lounge and connected PS4 controllers to the Steam Link. Luckily you are able to set up any program to be opened up from Steam so I installed a lot of games/emulators and can have everyone play whatever they want on the main TV. No issues with lag/delay and it really doesn't feel like you're streaming at all. For just $20 when I got it, it was a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Gaming in bed!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! Only wish i got it for $2 on a steam sale before they discontinued it! There's a quirk with it not working on the tv side sometimes due to me using the internet on the computer then using the tv but restarting steam on the pc fixes this. Also audio may not go on tv but a restart of tv fixes it. Now i can game in bed with my gf next to me instead of being in the man cave on my pc
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Works great as a replacement for my PS4 since I have ...
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you used wired connection for 3D games. Works great as a replacement for my PS4 since I have a larger PC gaming collection than on console. Tested games: Brawlhalla (wifi ok) Rocket League (wifi ok, wired preferred) CS:GO (need wired) ArmA3 (need wired) ARK: Survival Evolved (need wired) DOOM (wifi ok SP, mp need wired) Fantastic device!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Not without its flaws but for the price you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: This works great. Is it perfect? No. I wish there was an actual *ON* button, which sucks when I want to use a keyboard and have to plug in a 360 controller to turn it on. I don't understand how something so simple isn't included. But honestly, that's not work knocking a star off. It works 95% of the time, and the 5% does suck but it's not a dealbreaker and could very well be my wireless card in my tower and not the link. I have the link wired directly into my router and it works like a charm. For the price anything under 5 stars would just be nitpicking.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Speiser

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, but it's not quite there yet.
customer_reviews.text: Great concept, but it's not quite there yet. If you have to be wireless, you are going to have issues. I have mine plugged into my router and it's fine for single player games like Borderlands or Portal. But for multi-player games like Rocket League, there is just too much of a delay to be competitive. It got a little better when I streamed 720p (...still wired, too), but ultimately the delay was more frustrating than fun. I kept mine because for $20, it's worth it. Sometimes it's fun to play on the couch... I just wish I could play all my games on the couch without delay and not be limited to single-player 'casual' games.
customer_reviews.author: MidTwentiesDude

customer_reviews.title: this should work just fine.
customer_reviews.text: I use it completely wirelessly which means theres a noticeable amount of lag. But for games/etc where precision isn't an issue, (point and click adventure games, RPG's), this should work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: RogerSapien

customer_reviews.title: Great way to expand gaming experience to the couch
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty cool, hooked it up in minutes to my TV in the basement, now I can play most of my PC games down there using the power of my gaming rig in the upstairs office. I will say though that if I play any online games, I notice some lag that isn't present on my PC. For now I'm just going to stick to single player or local multiplayer games for this. Also, highly recommend only playing controller only games with this, even though it can use a mouse and keyboard, but that's not really what this is meant for.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua J Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't like wireless, and probably needs a beefier computer/router to ...
customer_reviews.text: Cons; Doesn't like wireless, and probably needs a beefier computer/router to reliably handle the bandwidth. Also, flaky at properly turing on sometimes. My TV supports CEC, and it just sits there, fiddling with Steam on the PC or unplugging the power to the Link usually gets it working. Pros: When it's up and running, it's great. I have the Steam Link connected through ethernet, and my PC (in a different room), over 802.11ac. It's like sitting in front of the computer for me. TL;DR: It's great, but also flaky at times. When it works - 5 stars, but due to the flakiness, 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for Origin games
customer_reviews.text: Got this to stream SW:Battlefront to my TV, and couldn't get it to work... and I tried all of the recommendations on all of the different forums. Got sound, part of the picture in the beginning, then nothing else. Screen would just freeze. Never scaled to correct resolution either. Ended up using nVidia GameStream which has worked perfectly for streaming everything from my computer. Overall the design was nice, form factor so it would have complimented my entertainment setup, and it was easy to initially setup and configure.
customer_reviews.author: randy21mTop Contributor: Baseball

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value. Compatible with 3rd party controllers. Requires manual PC unlocking.
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy this little device exists and supports all types of controllers. I bought some XBOX One Wireless bluetooth controllers to use with this, and they work surprisingly well. From what I've witnessed, lag is not a problem at all for the types of games I play. It opens up all of my steam games to use on my big screen TV in the media room. My biggest gripe is that I have to go upstairs to unlock my PC to use it. I wish I could just unlock the PC remotely over Steam somehow.
customer_reviews.author: El Outsider

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solid. The setup was effortless and almost entirely ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid. The setup was effortless and almost entirely automated. The image quality is sharp and steady. I even played some Rocket League on another floor, across the house, over WiFi at 1080p without dropping a frame. Sometimes audio hiccups, but only about every 5 minutes for half a second. For a cheap, easy device, I'm thrilled. Note: While it's designed for Steam and Big Picture Mode, you absolutely can use the Windows Desktop and all Windows programs, and it absolutely works with Logitech wireless keyboard mice / keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Illithidbane

customer_reviews.title: Great unit IF WIRED
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit and wired it into an ethernet switch before going to my router with my office pc upstairs. The Steam box being downstairs by my tv. It works very well when hardwired. I haven't noticed any lag and the sound and graphics are great. I tried using it one day wirelessly as a test and it was awful. Lag and stutter constantly and it would freeze up from time to time. I have a dual band ASUS router and my network is 150MB external and 1G internal. In summary, this works great if you're hardwired and plopped on the couch but I'd avoid using it wirelessly.
customer_reviews.author: Gordonius

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Sweet
customer_reviews.text: When looking at the specs I saw that is had only 100 mbps LAN and wondered why, of all things on a streaming box, they would skimp out on networking speed. But to my surprise, this thing works great! Steam's really outdone themselves and made a product that genuinely brings PC gaming to the living room! When connected through ethernet, streaming works great! I can't even tell that it's not running from right where the Steam Link is at. I have yet to experience any frame-rate dips, so far I am completely satisfied. way to go Valve!
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Volk

customer_reviews.title: It Needs To Be Better
customer_reviews.text: It's a great idea, but it is useless unless plugged directly into the router. I have an nVidia Shield (the first one that came out, the portable) and it worked flawlessly with my 5GHz band router, but this thing skips an incredible amount and has an incredible amount of latency. A product from 3 and a half years ago that doesn't even have broadcasting as its main function and it can easily outperform this hardware that can ONLY stream.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Sechrist

customer_reviews.title: jittery. unplayable. compatibility issues
customer_reviews.text: I have a Archer C7 AC1750 router 10 feet from my computer and tv setup. still gameplay is jittery and unplayable. I've gotten my Nvidia Shield to work with the same setup so I think it's the shield not my network. Also the interface wouldn't recognize my Xbox 360 controller with usb dongle. I'm not that mad because I got this on sale for 15$ but don't pay retail and take a chance.
customer_reviews.author: jon9

customer_reviews.title: Steamcast Pi
customer_reviews.text: A great device that works best with a wired network, but packs good wireless performance on a well managed wireless network. You aren't locked in to Steam when connected either. For example I used this to steam music and video stored on my computer. Compression is noticeable but not a deal breaker for me. I picked this up for $15 during the steam sale. $30 might be pushing it with how old this device is getting but it's still a cheap solution. It has the same cpu as the original chromecast (i own also and like) but better gpu.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my projector
customer_reviews.text: Note in Steam Big Picture you can go to the power button and choose Minimize Big Picture to user your PC from the desktop. You can lose windows on secondary monitors which will not be disabled. Perfect video and steam controller response playing Skyrim: Special Edition and others over ~30 feet of CAT6 through Google Fiber's network device. Plan on getting a compact wireless keyboard, mouse, and headset for chatting on Discord and will try to remember to update. Also plan on plugging in several Xbox 360 controllers to play Super Smash Flash 2 with Xpadder; we'll see how that works.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Lower

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good on wireless AC
customer_reviews.text: Setup can take a little time to fine-tune, but once you've got settings that work for you, it's a fantastic device. On wireless AC, I find it's perfect for streaming strategy games and even your desktop. Easier to use than the abstraction of a Chromecast. Don't know if this would work for FPS style games, but my use case was basically games like X-Com and accessing Netflix, etc. from my desktop.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kishor

customer_reviews.title: It has wireless... don't use the wireless
customer_reviews.text: If you want to have a good experience, you HAVE to wire it. I ran wireless for a few weeks, and it dropped, stuttered, froze, etc. It was a mess. I finally ran ethernet, and *poof*, full resolution, much lower latency, clean visuals. Night and day. I ended up buying another one to put downstairs too. It has worked with my xbox 360 controller, my ps3 controller, and my steam controller. I still plan on trying my snes controller when I find a good game that supports them.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan O Roskelley

customer_reviews.title: Magic - with a couple of flaws
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pure magic, props to Valve. I had previously been streaming my PC to my TV using a Chromecast though it absolutely doesn't work with video games because of the low frame rate with high latency. The Steam Link makes me feel like I'm playing my PC games on my Xbox, even though it's running in a different room. From time to time I run into issues, such as audio not playing correctly, input no longer working, etc. I am still giving a 5 star review because it's a tricky problem to solve and it's made great strides in doing so. This is contingent on me hoping that these problems will be solved in the future.
customer_reviews.author: AGuyWithADogWhoCodes

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with driving wheels or arcade controls, playing games are ok by cable.
customer_reviews.text: We tried to make it work with logitech driving wheels and it's no use, we use it to stream the desktop from the main pc and for that it woks fine. It will work ok with the games but we had issues even with cable with some, the controls is better to just use xbox or ps4 controls. Of course everything is connected by a long ethernet cable otherwise this will be impossible because of the lag.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Esteban Vargas Opitz

customer_reviews.title: ) but didn't like playing those type of games in front of a ...
customer_reviews.text: At the sale price, definitely worth it compared to Chromecast. I wanted to grab this to start finishing many single player games (Skyrim, Fallout, Assassin's Creed, etc.) but didn't like playing those type of games in front of a small monitor. Unfortunately, there were some settings to play around with before being able to play, but nothing you can't figure out (ie. I had to switch from gamepad controller to keyboard and mouse. You can also "exit" out of Steam and just use it to mirror your desktop and browse or play non-steam games. I definitely recommend a hardwired connection since when it was on WiFi, playing anything was unbearable.
customer_reviews.author: Paul lalo

customer_reviews.title: A Steal for $20.
customer_reviews.text: This item regularly goes on sale for $20 and if you can catch it at that price then I can certainly recommend it because at that price it is a steal for what it does. Hardwire if you can. If you can't then connect it to your 5g Wifi. If you can't do that then stay away from games where latency could rob you of enjoyment. In my time the image quality has dropped twice but quickly fixed itself. The box worked with my wired 360 controller, my steam controller, and my DualShock 4.
customer_reviews.author: C.

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the sale price..
customer_reviews.text: I bought the steam link on sale for ~$20. If it were the original price I don't think it would be worth the money. It's fantastic if you have a great ethernet connection to your streaming machine. If you don't then I wouldn't bother buying it, even over ethernet I'm still finding some small amounts of lag here and there. Although every single player game is very playable. I've only ever used it for playing games or music through our stereo system. You can minimize Steam Big Picture mode and just use it to remote control your computer which is cool, but streaming Netflix or video seems too choppy to use properly.
customer_reviews.author: Cortlan

customer_reviews.title: Forget consoles. This is it.
customer_reviews.text: PC gaming is defined by the flexibility it provides, and the Steam Link crack opens up the doors to the last console hold-out: the big screen. 1080p/4K gaming at 60fps locked on your TV, for any game, is a thing of beauty. Xbox One controller, DualShock controller, all compatible. Latest beta client releases support many more controller types (check the forums). And you get to keep your PC in your quiet place. No bulky towers on the side of your TV. Absolutely 100% Recommended. Now just waiting for a 4K/HDR version of the Steam Link to upgrade my complete big screen setup (new GPU, new TV, new Speakers).
customer_reviews.author: RED

customer_reviews.title: One PC to control them all
customer_reviews.text: Nice product for integrating a PC into a living room setup without having to mount the PC there. It allows mirroring of most PC functions through the network. Using this with the controller, and you have a good alternative to console gaming with a better feature set.
customer_reviews.author: Chris James

customer_reviews.title: The quality isn't great, even with a really good computer and router
customer_reviews.text: It gets a little hot when running for a long time. The quality isn't great, even with a really good computer and router. Plus it can't be used if the internet goes down, if steam isn't signed in to the internet you're unable to use in-home streaming apparently. That was a major bummer finding out that I couldn't play offline games because my internet was down... Half the reason I have offline games is for those times when the internet is down...
customer_reviews.author: Dan Colwell

customer_reviews.title: Streamlined and easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Wow, for once setting up and installing new tech was easy. You can really tell they put thought in making the process intuitive. I spent more time unpackaging than setting up. Once I had it on it worked right away. Pictures nice and clear with no weird border issues or tech problems. I did loose connection once but it was a game error. This was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Korbin in Dallass

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little box!!
customer_reviews.text: I only have had this wonderful box for only a few days and I was very skeptical at first. But too my surprise works amazing. I am using it on a 5ghz wifi connection and a 980ti system. Have only experienced a few slight lags and video quality degradation. A straight network cable connection or power line connection would eliminate this problem. Simple setup between Windows 10 and the steam controller. Also works great with a Xbox 360 controller. Was able too run apps from my pc including kodi with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Sean S.

customer_reviews.title: not a good streaming even with google wifi
customer_reviews.text: I liked the idea of streaming what my pc has just with this machine, even connecting via cable the communication some times gets slow and it loses quality so it's way better to move a laptop if you have one, maybe a good option if you have a desktop and it's very hard to move
customer_reviews.author: Peter E.

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says it does. I haven't used mine a whole lot so I can't comment about it too much. But it did take a little bit of time to get setup but it was a breeze using it after that. I opted-in to connecting it directly to the router rather than using wifi. Not because of lag or anything, just because I didn't want to be hogging up all of the wifi and it was sitting right next to my whole PC / internet setup anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: " Too bad there's only a 1 month return policy from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Used it maybe 8 times in two months. Now it won't boot. I unplug it from power, wait 2 or 3 minutes, and plug power back in. There's no HDMI output whatsoever. Both LEDs by the network jack turn on and stay lit continuously. The Steam support website troubleshooter states "Your Steam Link may be experiencing a hardware failure or unrecoverable firmware error." Too bad there's only a 1 month return policy from Amazon...
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Benson

customer_reviews.title: Never Worked Properly
customer_reviews.text: First let me tell you that all the times I have tried to use Steamlink, is wired. I have never used it wireless. Therefore, I should have no problems, right? Since the day I bought it, Mayo 2016, I have not been able to make it work properly. One I managed to play for a while a 2D indie game. After that, never. Definitely not worth it. Also, I have seen Valve selling Steam Links for $5. If you want on, get it at that price. Even $20 is money thrown to the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: JUAN C GONZALEZ

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality product and functional but the reaction time is ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality product and functional but the reaction time is a little deteriorating the quality of the game, although I use it with the ac1200 powerline I could not get the quality as I wanted. It is recommended to withdraw cable from the modem and it also supports non-steam games and movies. (Sorry for the bad english i am using google translation)
customer_reviews.author: MURAT

customer_reviews.title: Network cable and wifi (5ghz) show the same performance As I understand valve not support hw stream acceleration so if you have
customer_reviews.text: Well, it is ultimate solution to the problem of having tv and pc in different rooms, however it allows to play casually with pc in its place. Network cable and wifi (5ghz) show the same performance As I understand valve not support hw stream acceleration so if you have amd card like I do - you will have average to poor image quality. Controllers like xb360 detected only in games added to steam library, in games from windows store only kb/mouse support
customer_reviews.author: Dmytro

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how much use I got out of this little streamer once I actually hooked it up. It works incredibly well with games played through Steam as long as you're either wired or have a very good wireless router. Even though it's optimized for Steam streaming, it doesn't do too bad for desktop streaming if you want to watch videos and the like.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you don't need non-gaming functions, this will optimize your in-home streaming experience over a PC.
customer_reviews.text: Vs using a PC: Pros: More optimized than a PC. Less lagging/dropped frames. This surprised me. Cons: Don't have full functionality that the PC provides (Link less convenient for web searching and other non-gaming functions.) Overall, very happy with the purchase. If you don't need non-gaming functions, this will optimize your in-home streaming experience over a PC.
customer_reviews.author: ClayJitsu

customer_reviews.title: Stuttery unless you have a top of the line computer. I may just hook up my computer to the tv with an HDMI cable.
customer_reviews.text: It would be nice if Steam let you know that you cannot stream with older computers like a dual core. It has to be a fairly uptown computer or else the games stutter. I am wired and all games stutter. They are playable in single player mode but stutter. I am using my son's Quad core computer, older A7 chip, 16gb ram, nvidia gt730. The games are smooth as silk on the computer but stutter and delayed a little on the 60" tv.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and this quality it might be useful sometimes, but going that way might create some ...
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says, still sometimes when manipulating the device one can find oneself not being able to show the content. That is, the primary purpose is to cast the game to whatever the device is attached to. But then again it can also cast what the desktop of the controlling computer is showing, and this quality it might be useful sometimes, but going that way might create some sync issues between the Steam app and the content being displayed. Aside from that it works very well and with Ethernet connected all is smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Good product but there's still some room for imrovement
customer_reviews.text: Most of the time works perfectly fine, but there're some issues. I managed to find 2 bugs that I can re-create :) 1) You can change some of the pad settings, like startup sound, only from the PC. If plugged into the Link this operation crashes the Steam Client on PC 2) Some of the games act weirdly, i.e. on the monitor the picture while moving was fine and smooth, but on a TV it was extremely lagging. The network wasn't loaded at all and I'm connected through Eth cable. And it wasn't the case for games like new Doom. Well, there's still room for improvement...
customer_reviews.author: Yuriy

customer_reviews.title: To be fair my roommate tripped on the power cable and yanked it from the back of the device but still seems like a pretty weak s
customer_reviews.text: Would have gotten 5 stars but the power connector barrel jack in the unit seems to have come loose very quickly. To be fair my roommate tripped on the power cable and yanked it from the back of the device but still seems like a pretty weak solder connection to come out so easily. When the power is getting through the device works as advertised, it really requires a wired connection through your network but that aside the quality and speed of the streaming is pretty impressive and lets me use a large HD screen with the noisy computer in another room.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Husain

customer_reviews.title: More than just Steam games in you living room
customer_reviews.text: It is one of the most helpful items I have ever purchased. It basically puts what is on my desktop PC screen upstairs on my tv in the living room. I use a wired connection, which works beautifully. Not one problem so far, except the documentation is less than threadbare. I'm learning things it can do as I go along. All I thought it could do is play Steam games to whatever display it is connected to, but it does so much more.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Lambuth

customer_reviews.title: Makes playing my PC games on the TV a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: Makes playing my PC games on the TV a lot easier, but it has some quirks that you need to force restart the device to resolve, which requires unplugging and changing the source input on my receiver since there's no power button on the Link. Audio gets lost sometimes between the TV and PC, and other times it's the visuals. In one case, I could see my desktop and hear the game I launched through the TV, but it never showed the game. All issues have been resolved with resets.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Ageless console
customer_reviews.text: No need to buy a console ever again. Consider hard-wiring the LAN connection as the wifi can be laggy if you live in an urban environment with 30 other wifi networks in your area. I recommend getting a decent bluetooth keyboard and mouse (my logitech models work great) and a little lap desk for the couch. Now you can play games in true PC style (of course, also have a steam/xbox/playstation controller for more arcade-style games)
customer_reviews.author: Dr. G.

customer_reviews.title: I like it when it works but I wish it worked more often.
customer_reviews.text: I have a hard time with this unit. When it works it's pretty great, but it doesn't even seem to work perfectly with all steam games. I understand it now working very well on non steam games, I wish it did, but I can understand when it doesn't. But it should at least work well for all games that you get and play through steam... Right?....right? I think that's a reasonable request. I'm using a Steam controller with it by the way, which I am actually pretty fond of.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi B.

customer_reviews.title: Just get any HDMI splitter instead.
customer_reviews.text: The moment I turned it on I had to turn it off and try again. It would not properly register my controller. It streams games fine but only works about as well as Steam Big Picture works. (it crashes a lot) And it's desktop streaming crops the image and shutters. So video streaming sucks too. I've given this thing plenty of opportunity to work but its only been good at letting me down.
customer_reviews.author: Arison

customer_reviews.title: It does more than I was expecting it to, but some games run poorly.
customer_reviews.text: This things pretty good. Not only can you play your Steam games on it, but you can also alt-tab out of steam and play movies and whatever else on your tv. I went a little crazy and hooked up Ethernet cables to everything, hoping it would make everything run smoothly, but it didn't help. Even though my computer was getting 60 fps, the steam link was getting extremely poor frames. I'll try out some less stressing games and update this. I also want to add that if the steam link were unable to stream movies from my computer, I would give it 1 star due to it being unable to do that successfully.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: The Steam Link really does what it says to do
customer_reviews.text: The Steam Link really does what it says to do. I have not noticed any lag yet, not even with the fastest paced games (I have a 30MB/s internet connection). The hardware itself feels sturdy and tight, very high quality. I highly recommend it. About the price: $50 bucks!? Cannot be any better. Note: Its highly recommeded, despite the fact that you can use the Steam Link via wifi, to directly connect the steam link via cable to your router in order to have the highest performace.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Amazing device if you set up right
customer_reviews.text: Anyone complaining about lagginess hasn't invested properly in setting up correctly. You can run a wire if you want, but I bought TP Link's AV500 powerline adapter to do a wired setup. I've run Skyrim SE, Doom, MK XL all at high settings with no noticeable lag. Syncing OEM Ps3 controllers couldn't be easier, just need the cord and a controller. Bought this for a workout room, bought another for bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy D

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: I am posting this review from my Steam Link right now. It has about 30 to 35 ms delay in most games while on wifi, I will update this review when I connect it via Ethernet. Setting up the device was easy and authentication was just a 4 number security code on my main rig. The gameplay experience was just okay via wifi, hard to play rocket league and overwatch with that much delay. However, in overwatch I played as winston, requiring less accuracy, and it was a fun experience.
customer_reviews.author: EzD

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy so far
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when it was on sale for $15! I've been curious about the product, and at that price I decided to go for it. I'm very happy so far; the setup was very easy and it is able to steam all the games I've tried so far. Like the product advises I'm using it on a wired connection. Unless you've got a great wireless setup at home you'll probably be unhappy with this on wireless. PS4 controller works fine with it also!
customer_reviews.author: Tristan

customer_reviews.title: Good Product Especially if You Have a Steam Controller
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget allows me to play Steam Games on my TV. This is really convenient since a few of my Steam Games aren't really PC Games. The only problem I had was that this shipped with a terrible HDMI cable. The graphics were terrible until I swapped it for one of the better ones I had at home. I almost returned it until I made the switch thinking this wasn't working.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great product in great shape and quick shipping!
customer_reviews.text: What a great device! This little box truly helps me feel like I'm living in the future by connecting my PC games to my TV and allowing me to play from my couch rather than my chair. So incredible! Arrived in perfect condition (small ding on the box which I was warned about beforehand, product unharmed) and it arrived far faster than I thought it would.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... Ethernet there are still moments where the game gets pretty bad input lag
customer_reviews.text: Even while using Ethernet there are still moments where the game gets pretty bad input lag. Tested gauntlet on steam with 3 players. Update: It is now 2017, and the device is practically worthless and unsupported by Valve. Though they are curiously still advertising and selling the last of the stock. Do everything you can to avoid this sort of thing. Just get a gaming laptop, or carry your rig where it needs to be.
customer_reviews.author: Ksaku

customer_reviews.title: If you want to stream your Steam games to your living room without building another PC, get one.
customer_reviews.text: Streams my games to my living room. So far, it works better than trying to do the same thing with a PC running Steam facilitating streaming. I haven't noticed any lag or skipping over AC wireless or wired connections. My only issue with it is that if you are using a wireless XBOX controller, once the unit goes to sleep the controller won't wake it. If you have a keyboard plugged in, or a Steam Controller, those will wake the box, but it seems the XBOX wireless receiver loses connection or doesn't have wake on USB support with the device.
customer_reviews.author: J. Airington

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for party style games on the couch
customer_reviews.text: I was always very interested in the steam link and it was a great purchase. I set it up via 5ghz wifi and I do not have any problems with latency. Mind you the router is just 15 feet away from the steam link so the connection is very strong. It is super easy to set up and the quality is great. I have only played party style games on it, but latency and lag has never been a problem. I recommend that you set it up via Ethernet if you quite far from the router.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: This is the 2nd one I've purchased. I lost ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one I've purchased. I lost the first one because of a move so I had to buy another. They both worked exactly as advertised provided everything is connected via a wired connection. (the computer and the steam link). I even use a wireless controller connected to the steam link and have had no problem playing games in the family room while the computer is running in my office. If you want to play your steam games on a TV in a different room with your xbox controller and you have a wired connection, this is definitely for you.
customer_reviews.author: Wallruss
